title: Congratulating Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Eckes upon the occasion of celebrating their 50th Wedding Anniversary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION congratulating Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Eckes upon the
occasion of celebrating their 50th Wedding Anniversary

WHEREAS,  Wilbur  and Carol Eckes were united in marriage on December 4,
1960 at Sparrowbush United Methodist Church; and
  WHEREAS, The couple celebrated their 50th Wedding Anniversary  with  a
dinner  held in their honor by their family; in addition, their children
gave them a trip to Yellowstone National Park in Wyoming, to be taken in
the summer of 2011; and
  WHEREAS, They are the proud parents of the  late  Wilbur  Eckes,  Jr.,
David  Eckes, and Lennie Schiefer, and her husband, Mark, and the loving
grandparents of four grandchildren, Sarah Simpson, Megan  Eckes,  Daniel
Schiefer and Mikaylee Eckes; and
  WHEREAS, Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Eckes are and always have been a tower of
strength,  support,  understanding  and limitless love for their family;
and
  WHEREAS, Their love, devotion, caring, sensitivity and  responsiveness
to  their  family,  friends and all who know them are their hallmark and
tradition; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 48 years, Wilbur Eckes has been a  self-employed
owner  of  Eckes  Auto Body; he enjoys hunting and fishing, and is known
for cooking the best pot of soup around; and
  WHEREAS, Carol Eckes is also self-employed; she has been the owner  of
Lenny's  Place  Ice  Cream Stand for the past 36 years; she enjoys being
outdoors and has an annual vegetable and flower garden that could be  on
the cover of BETTER HOMES AND GARDENS; and
  WHEREAS,  Together,  Wilbur  and  Carol  Eckes  take pleasure in being
involved in community affairs, politics, volunteer work  and  traveling;
and
  WHEREAS,  Mr.  and  Mrs.  Wilbur Eckes have lived and continue to live
their lives with great dignity and genuine grace, always demonstrating a
deep and continuing concern for human  values  and  ideals,  and  in  so
doing, they have inspired others to do the same; and
  WHEREAS, This meaningful occasion is the result of the love, hard work
and spirit this couple has invested in their marriage; and
  WHEREAS,  These  same  values  they  have  passed to their loved ones,
producing a family that is close-knit and supportive of  its  individual
members,  public-minded  in its relations to the community and committed
to the ideals of citizenship upon which this Nation was founded; and
  WHEREAS, Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Eckes have touched  the  lives  of  their
family  and  many friends through the shining example of their marriage,
which is a testament to the devotion and admiration which  they  possess
for one another; and
  WHEREAS,  The  longevity of this enduring marriage truly marks a mile-
stone in life's journey, an event of personal triumph and joy; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  an  occa-
sion  of such importance is brought to our attention, the same should be
memorialized by us for the edification and  emulation  of  others;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Eckes upon the occasion of  celebrating
their 50th Wedding Anniversary; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Mr. and Mrs. Wilbur Eckes, P.O. 121, Sparrow Bush, New York
12780.
